alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 6:52PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sheridan, northeastern Gove and southwestern Graham Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 651 PM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Park, or 5 miles west of Quinter, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Public. Public reported pea to dime size hail south of Quinter. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Park around 655 PM CDT. Quinter around 700 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 100 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
